question:
With respect to NASA’s ARADS project deployed in the Atacama Desert, consider the following statements:
  1. The objective of Atacama Rover Astrobiology Drilling Studies project is to look for life on Mars.
  2. The ARADS drill can autonomously collect data from Mars’ surface.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: ARADS project is to look for evidences of life on Mars. The project will looks for microbe-like life or their fossils on the red planet. The project will use a drill atop a rover called the K-REX2. It will be able to dig up to 2m through rock, dry soil and salt to obtain samples for analyses. Statement 2 is correct: The drill in the ARADS project will be able to conduct operations autonomously. It will navigate, drill and collect samples without the need for real-time human input. It will be able to dislodge itself it gets stuck or frozen on the Mars. It will also transfer samples to its on-board instruments for analyses.
